author: Kevin Randall
comment: Only used a couple of days so far but seems accurate.

author: Sultan Alghanem
comment: It's awesome

author: Sally Bascombe
comment: Just stays on the loading screen.

author: Sterling C. Poteat, III
comment: I bought the Automatic OBD Device last year and kept getting prompted with the advertisement of the Find My Parked Car app.  So I tried it.  It worked for a while using the free version.  So I decided to buy the licensed version.  I did and now it doesn't automatically detect where I'm parked.  I read the advertisement and it said that I had to press a button to save my parking location.  I never had to to that before, and now after pressing the button the app still doesn't save my location.  The advertisement also says that it automatically detects where you park.  This is not true!!  The app shows where my phone is located (on which the app is running).  What is more frustrating is that the app shows a car picture as to indicate where I've parked.  Moreover, the advertisement says that it will prompt you to save the location.  I have yet to see a prompt even when I have it set in the settings to prompt me.  I'm so disappointed that I paid for the app.  I want a refund.

author: Michael C. Haigler
comment: Great app.  One of the few that lets you manually relocate your parking location.

comment: Will embarass you front of company. Just as you need to find your car. Horrible phone disabling adds will comeup freeze your phone Do not install...Horrible. Hated it!!!!

author: BINU K.R.
comment: Waste of money. Even after correct bluetooth settings it doesn't do the job with car Bluetooth recognition. Completely useless. I can't even add the car location manually. For that I need to delete old parked location. I don't see the option to save the parking now. :))

reply.author: Ofir Miron
reply.content: I apologize for the issues you are having. Please contact me directly via email at ofirmironinc@gmail.com, or use the Feedback button in the app settings.

comment: Top app
It works.. great app

Once opened on my watch, this app refused to close. No amount of tapping or swiping produced any results. My only option is therefore to uninstall it, making it only worth one star. ETA: New comment from the developer is blaming this on Android Wear as it 'Every Android Wear app that show a map cannot use the slide to the right gesture to exit the app.' Google Maps, however, does allow you to swipe to the right to close it. I use it regularly.

reply.author: Ofir Miron
reply.content: Here's the exact words taken from the Maps API: "you can implement the long-press-to-dismiss UI pattern, giving users a way to exit the app... This pattern is recommended because the Google Maps Android API overrides the standard left-to-right swipe usually used to exit a wearable app. In a Google Maps app, the swipe gesture is used to pan the map"

author: Clarence Wolfe
comment: I am using Android 7.1 on a Nexus 6P.  Version 4.4.2 of FMPC. On my device, neither of automatic parking or un-parking is working. Neither does the automatic launching of a driving app. I am able, however, to manually mark a parking location and manually delete it. I was able to use it recently to locate my car in a large lot after dark, which was much appreciated. The author is very responsive.
title: Functional Issues

author: Heather
comment: Good idea, but after trying forever to get it to work with my smartwatch I just gave up as it's not worth the headache. Installed and kept telling me an overlay was detected and that it needs to be turned off. Went into my settings and disabled EVERYTHING that showed is was turned "on" as an overly (which is ridiculous to have to make that many changes to begin with) restarted everything and it's still giving me the same error.  I've messed with it for too long already.

reply.author: Ofir Miron
reply.content:
Hello Heather,
Please contact me using the feedback button so that I could help you resolve the issue.
This is not a bug in my app, rather it is Android that does not allow you to grant the permission because another app has an overlay active on your screen. Try uninstalling apps that might create overlays like screen recording apps.

author: DJ Feezie
comment: It works fine on my phone but it says it needs location permission. It already has it

reply.author: Ofir Miron
reply.content:
Hello,
You must enable the location permission on the watch as well as on the phone for the application to work. If this does not work, try enabling the permission in the settings of your watch and phone.
If it still does not work, please email me at ofirmironinc@gmail.com, or use the feedback button in the application.

author: Jae Park
comment: The app would be better if users could link to other people's app so that people who share a car could have their apps automatically updated with the car's location. Right now my husband and I have to email each other the car's location. Also if the alarm allowed us to set a date as well as a time, we could set alarms for street cleaning.
title: Good but could be better

author: Paul B
comment: Most Professionally Crafted App Of Any Type! This app is intuitive, powerful, compact and fun to use. I installed it on a cheapie ZTE phone with Android 5.1 and tested it for over a week. The app never failed to function. It is beautifully written. I tried many parking spot apps & this one beats them. I like being able to quickly (very quickly) mark my park. Bam! Done! Here Are Some Features That I Especially Appreciate: A) If the GPS on your phone miss marks the parking location, it is easy to drag the icon to the correct spot. <Mis-Mark is the GPS fault, not the app. All of my GPS devices mis-mark in certain areas.>  B) The map is very easy to view and I really like being able to quickly switch from seeing the car, seeing my location or seeing both at once. C) Taking a photo and leaving myself a note from within the app are handy to have when parking where there is no signal. No fussing around between apps. D) Using it offline works well too. If your device already has a map of the area, Find My Parked Car simply shows the map as if you are on line. (Save data time!) The developer/engineer answers questions very quickly, politely and thoroughly.  I like this app!

author: Garrett McFall
comment: Can you manually move a pin? Say you forgot to set the location immediately after exiting the car, you're a block or 2 from the actual parking spot, and you need to slightly adjust the dropped pin? I might not remember which direction those 2 blocks are from the pin at the end of a long day!

reply.author: Ofir Miron
reply.content:
Hi Garrett,
Yes you can! Just long press the car marker until you feel a vibration, then drag it around and drop it at the correct location.
If you have more questions, please email me at ofirmironinc@gmail.com

title: Manual Pin Drop

author: Harv Simmons
comment: it shows the location of the car OK, and it shows your current location, but it's difficult to get a reading on how to get from here to there, which direct to walk, left/right, north/south, orientation, etc., how do you get to your car?!

reply.author: Ofir Miron
reply.content:
Hi Harv,
You can start a turn-by-turn walking navigation that will guide you exactly to your car by pressing the rightmost button on the bottom.
Please contact me at ofirmironinc@gmail.com if you have more questions.

title: difficult to navigate
